file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 26-14-01-07 - SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the lavatory smoke detector. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY FOR AIRCRAFT PRE- LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - CLEAN- 26-14-01-100-801-A ♦ MOD SB 145-26-0014 ING FOR AIRCRAFT POST- LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - CLEAN- 26-14-01-100-802-A ♦ MOD SB 145-26-0014 ING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 26-14-01 Page 1 of 4 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-14-01-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT PRE-MOD SB 145-26-0014 2. LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the lavatory smoke detector. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber gloves Hand protection 1 available Commercially Safety goggles Eye protection 1 available Commercially Wiper-Soft, Lint-Free Equipment for cleaning AR available E. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-I-735 Isopropyl Alcohol - Commercial grade AR F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory H. Lavatory Smoke Detector (Figure 701) SUBTASK 340-002-A WARNING: WEAR GLOVES AND GOGGLES DURING CLEANING OPERATIONS. (1) Clean the lavatory smoke detector sensor (1) and cover plate (2) with isopropyl alcohol to remove all dust deposit. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT PRE-MOD SB 145-26-0014 Lavatory Smoke Detector - Location Figure 701 B A SMOKE DETECTOR ZONE SENSOR 273 DUST DEPOSIT (REF.) LAVATORY DET. A 2. COVER PLATE 1. SMOKE DETECTOR SENSOR DET. B EM145AMM260155A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 26-14-01 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 26-14-01-100-802-A EFFECTIVITY: FOR AIRCRAFT POST-MOD SB 145-26-0014 3. LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the lavatory smoke detector. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200 STATIC GROUNDING - STANDARD PRACTICES AMM TASK 26-14-01-000-801-A/400 LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - REMOVAL AMM TASK 26-14-01-400-801-A/400 LAVATORY SMOKE DETECTOR - INSTALLATION CMM 26-11-18 - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory I. Preparation SUBTASK 340-003-A (1) Keep the aircraft grounded ( AMM TASK 20-40-02-910-801-A/200). (2) Remove the lavatory smoke detector ( AMM TASK 26-14-01-000-801-A/400) and send it to an authorized shop. J. Lavatory Smoke Detector SUBTASK 340-003-B (1) To do the procedure, refer to the last revision of CMM 26-11-18 from Cerberus Guinard. (2) Put the lavatory smoke detector in its installation position and install it ( AMM TASK 26-14-01-400-801-A/400.
